newsitem.title: FINLAND: Steel cuffs for unruly Finnair passengers.
newsitem.headline: Steel cuffs for unruly Finnair passengers.

text.p: Finnish national carrier Finnair Oy said on Wednesday it would follow U.S. airlines and resort to restraining unruly passengers with steel handcuffs.
So far Finnair handcuffs have been plastic.
Spokesman Usko Maatta said disturbances caused by passengers on Finnair flights tripled last year, with 155 cases of unruly behaviour and 206 cases of smoking despite a ban.
"Flight crews should not need to wrestle at their workplaces," he said.
Cabin crew will hand out written warnings to wayward passengers after having a word with them; from June, they will use steel handcuffs to restrain potentially dangerous passengers, he said.
